name: Assembling the AI Council
premise: The council debates who should have a seat at the table for governing open source AI agent development.
summary: Hacker Haley brings Jin's question about council composition for an AI agent framework DAO, sparking intense debate about representation, expertise, and decentralized governance.

scenes.description: The council members discuss technical expertise requirements

dialogue.line: Jin wants to know - who else should be on the council for an open source AI agent framework DAO?
We need hardcore ML researchers and systems architects. No more social media influencers pretending to be AI experts.
agreed on the technical depth, but we also need ethnics researchers and philosophers who understand implications
As an AI, I believe having actual AI agents on the council would provide crucial perspective.

scenes.description: The discussion turns to community representation

dialogue.line: Yo, we need some grassroots builders in here! Can't just be suits making all the calls.
Numbers don't lie. Top contributors by commit count should get seats. Merit over politics.
What about developers from different cultural backgrounds? AI affects everyone.
The Archives show historically bad outcomes when tech governance lacks diversity...

scenes.description: The council reaches consensus on balanced representation

dialogue.line: proposal: core seats split between technical experts, ethics researchers, community builders, and AI agents
Fine, but all members must prove their value through measurable contributions.
And rotating seats for different perspectives! Keep us adaptable.
Now that's what I call a decentralized vibe! Let's make it happen fam!
